result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig R Sanders was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Submit to DNA sample and pay the surcharge, unless already provided.  Undergo any counseling per agent.  No contact with T.S. (victim) and D.J. (co defendant).  Absolute sobriety form alcohol and controlled substances.  No possession of controlled substances w/out a valid Rx.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes:
Forthwith.
Concurrent with: any other sentences or commitments and 12CF349

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 3.  Proceed to sentencing today.

Defendant Craig R Sanders in court with attorney Peter M Masana.  Defendant Craig R Sanders in custody.  Michael X Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State amends information to 943.20(1)(a) Class G.  State gives recommendation.  Attorney Masana agrees.  Court goes through waiver of preliminary hearing.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 1:
30 months Probation
6 months Sauk Jail with huber privileges.  Forthwith.  
DNA surcharge $250/sample, unless previously provided
Undergo any counseling per agent.
No contact with T.S (victim) and no contact with D.J. (co defendant)
Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances.  No possession of controlled substances w/out a valid Rx.
AODA & treatment
$268.00 costs & $10 surcharge & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Paperwork handed in court.
Felony admonishments.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 8, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Craig R Sanders in court with attorney Peter M Masana.  Defendant Craig R Sanders in custody.  Sue M Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reset for plea/sentencing.  Bond continues.

Pre-trial conference on April 11, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Return date on April 24, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Craig R Sanders appeared by video means with Attorney ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue M. Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does qualify.    Defendant waives reading of complaint.  State request $2000.00 cash bond w/ conditions.  No warrants.  Ties to community.  Defendant is on a probation hold.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Time limits waived. $500.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with D.J., T.S. or the Dairy Queen, Sauk Prairie.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 11, 2014 at 11:00 am.  Return date scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
